customer_reviews.title: Amazon should remove this book
customer_reviews.text: $0.35 would be too expensive for this book. Another wannabe trying to profit from Buffett’s name. Misleading title. Copied. Regurgitated content copied and pasted into a thin excuse of a ‘book’ (sorry it’s ‘three books’). Like another reviewer said, Amazon should remove ‘books’ from these dishonest amateur authors masquerading as experts, blatantly exploiting Buffett’s name, and delivering nothing but copied and pasted content. customer_reviews.title: Excellent Starter Book

When you want to get into more detail, I recommend The Intelligent Investor, Rev. Ed. But please note that this book is not written by Warren Buffet. It is a condensed version of Buffett's favorite three books (Intelligent Investor, Security Analysis, and Wealth of Nations) designed to make the sometimes incredibly detailed and dense content of those three texts simple and accessible to those who do not understand terms like working capital, current ratio, or book value.

customer_reviews.text: I have learned a lot about doing due diligence on stocks before I invest in them - using equity, P/E ratio, current ration, debt ratio etc. I also learned that investing in stocks in long term and so i should consider the intrinsic value of a company. Wow! I feel like I am a professional investor - though I know it is arrogant to think I know anything after reading only one book

customer_reviews.author: Joseph Widlan

customer_reviews.title: Excelent summary of Ben Graham books
customer_reviews.text: It is a very good summary of the concepts of value investing. It is very clear and didactic The videos are very helpful. This book helped me to strengthen the knowledge obtained from Ben Graham's books which are much more complicated and difficult to read. I recommend reading this book and immediately re-read Ben Graham's books: Security Analysis and The Intelligent Investor

customer_reviews.title: Great book for a beginner with solid lessons
customer_reviews.text: I've been trading for a few years but never fully understood what I was doing. Its not a how to book. It's a book that teaches you how to recognise what you should be doing for yourself . I believe this book is a good way to start and good value for the time invested reading it. I would recommend this for anyone starting or interested in trading and investments.
